properties.address: W Foster Ave, east of N Ciecero Ave

properties.name: Cranberry Slough Nature Preserve

properties.name: McMahon Woods and Fen Nature Preserve
Bluff Spring Fen
properties.address: Bluff City Cemetery, 945 Bluff City Blvd
properties.description: The 160-acre Bluff Spring Fen is named for its rare fen, a type of wetland fed by mineral-rich springs. The spring water stays a constant 50 degrees, so streams flow year-round, supporting an unusual assortment of plants and animals.

properties.name: Baker's Lake Nature Preserve
properties.description: The 330-acre Baker's Lake Forest Preserve (219 acres are Illinois Nature Preserve) is home to one of the most significant heron rookeries in the Midwest and offers many opportunities to view wildlife, especially large birds.

properties.name: Bluff Spring Fen Nature Preserve

properties.name: Bemis Woods-North

properties.name: Camp Shabbona Woods

properties.name: Busse Lake Boating Center
properties.address: E Higgins Rd/Rte 72, east of I-290/Hwy 53
properties.description: Ned Brown Preserve (or Busse Woods) has 3,558-acres of land and 460-acres of water to explore. That's pretty big—so plan ahead and select the parking lot nearest your activity of choice.
properties.special_hours: Rentals Available Early April to Late October
properties.special_description: View boat rental and concessions options

properties.name: Maple Lake Boating Center
properties.address: Wolf Rd, south of 95th St
properties.special_hours: Rentals Available Early April to Late October
properties.special_description: View boat rental and concessions options

properties.name: Crabtree Nature Center
properties.address: 3 Stover Rd
properties.description: Over 1,000 acres of rolling, glacier formed landscape is set aside as Crabtree Nature Center. An exhibit building opens to several miles of self-guiding trails and an extensive nature play area.
properties.special_hours: Closed Thanksgiving, Christmas, New Year's Day

properties.name: Little Red Schoolhouse Nature Center
properties.address: 9800 Willow Springs Rd
properties.description: Little Red Schoolhouse Nature Center opened in 1955, and has educated and delighted generations of families in Cook County. In 2010 a new visitor center with live animals, exhibits and more joined the old school.
properties.special_hours: Closed Thanksgiving, Christmas, New Year's Day

properties.name: Sagawau Environmental Learning Center
properties.address: 12545 West 111th St
properties.description: Sagawau Environmental Learning Center includes exhibits on geology, history, and habitat management. The center features tours of Cook County's only canyon, the banding program of the Chicagoland Bird Observatory and groomed cross-country skiing trails.
properties.special_hours: Closed Thanksgiving, Christmas, New Year's Day

properties.name: Sand Ridge Nature Center
properties.address: 15891 Paxton Ave
properties.description: Sand Ridge Nature Center features resident native wildlife, including birds of prey, reptiles and fish. Enjoy the hands-on Kid's Corner, a colorful butterfly garden, or reproduction log cabins depicting the lifestyles of early 19th Century Illinois.
properties.special_hours: Closed Thanksgiving, Christmas, New Year's Day

properties.name: Hal Tyrrell Trailside Museum
properties.address: 738 Thatcher Ave
properties.description: Discover displays of live native animals, colorful wildflower gardens, information about local wildlife and more. Natural-surfaced hiking trails wind through beautiful oak woodlands along the Des Plaines River.
properties.special_hours: Closed Thanksgiving, Christmas, New Year's Day

properties.name: River Trail Nature Center
properties.address: 3120 Milwaukee Ave
properties.description: At River Trail Nature Center visitors can walk through sugar maple woods along the river on self-guiding trails, learn of the past and present in the exhibit building and visit a few of our native animals.
properties.special_hours: Closed Thanksgiving, Christmas, New Year's Day

properties.name: General Headquarters
properties.address: 536 N Harlem Ave
properties.description: Staff at our General Headquarters Permits Desk will help you with all your permit, rental and membership needs.
properties.special_hours: Permit desk may close on holidays, call ahead to confirm.
properties.special_description: View permit information

properties.name: Mathew Bieszczat Volunteer Resource Center
properties.address: 6100 N Central
properties.description: Mathew Bieszczat Volunteer Resource Center is home to the Forest Preserves Volunteer Resources team and a popular venue for events.
properties.special_description: Volunteer Resource Center available for indoor & indoor/outdoor event rentals

properties.name: Deer Grove West Woodland & Wetland Nature Preserve
properties.description: The 1,800-acre Deer Grove was the first preserve acquired by the Forest Preserves in 1916. Deer Grove's varied landscapes makes it a premier destination for both recreation and nature exploration.
